descriptionHtml:
Name: Vampirism Tweaks
Version: 0.5
Date: 15 April 2012
Category: Gameplay effects and changes
Requirements:
	Skyrim 1.5.26.0.5
	kuertee Actor events: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=15219
Author: kuertee
Source: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=15221

Short description
=================
Tweaks to Vampirism: feeding off NPCs (with a Confidant relationship or more) from Dialogue; feeding on newly dead NPCs;
	feeding heals Health, Magicka and Stamina; Relationship increases with NPCs fed on; your vision grows red as you
	starve; circular blur on Night-eye is removed; Night-eye has no duration.

Gameplay changes
================
Feed from dialogue:
	You can feed off NPCs that have a Relationship Rank with you of Confidant level or more by conversing with them.
	I.e. they do not need to be asleep.

Feed from newly dead NPCS:
	You can drain the blood of recently dead NPCs by Activating on their corpse.

Effects of feeding:
	The Relationship Rank of NPCs you feed from are increased up to Ally level.

	You can delay the transformation to the stage of Vampirism by a second day by feeding on newly dead NPCs. Feeding
	a second time on live NPCs will also increase the length of the first stage of Vampirism by a second day.

	Some Health, Magicka and Stamina are restored after feeding. The amount is dependant on the NPC\'s \"base\" Health.

	Feeding on a newly dead vampire will regress your Vampirism by one stage. Feeding on a live vampire is as per
	the unmodded game. I.e. feeding on a live vampire will set your Vampirism to the first stage.

	NPCs who witness you feeding will not converse with you. You can make them forget that you are a vampire by
	feeding on them.

	Also, NPCs who see you at the fourth stage of Vampirism will also refuse your conversations. You can make them
	forget that you are a vampire by feeding on them also. Note that in the unmodded game, NPCs who see you at this
	stage will automatically attack you.

Blood-lust vision:
	Your normal vision will have a red tint that increases as you move up the different stages.

Night-eye tweaks:
	Night-eye is more useful with the circular blur and its duration removed.

Vampirsm stage progression bug-fix:
	There is a bug in the unmodded vampire Script. In the unmodded game, you do not change to the next stage of
	Vampirism when you are in combat. This effectively gives you another 12 hours in your current stage and decreases
	the time you are in the next stage by 12 hours.

	This mod fixes that.

Details
=======
	You can configure this mod in the Console by typing \"setpqv kuvtq <mod data> <value>\". E.g. to turn off blood-lust
	vision, type: \"setpqv kuvtq userBloodLustView False\".

	userFeedOnDead: True (default) or False
	userHealFromFeeding: True (default) or False
	userRefuseDialogue: True (default) or False
	userBloodLustView: True (default) or False
	userWarnOfChange: True (default) or False
	userRaiseRelationshipOnFeed: True (default) or False

Compatibility
=============
This may not be compatible with mods that change the default Vampirism.

For this to be compatible with a 3rd-party vampire mod, the Script PlayerVampireQuestScript need to be still attached to
the Quest PlayerVampireQuest.

Also these functions and variables from that Script need to be intact and working:
	PlayerVampireQuest.VampireStatus
	PlayerVampireQuest.LastFeedTime
	PlayerVampireQuest.VampireFeed ()
	PlayerVampireQuest.VampirePCFaction
	PlayerVampireQuest.VampireProgression ()
	PlayerVampireQuest.GameDaysPassed

	The PlayerVampireQuestScript has been changed to fix the bug in the Vampirism stage progression. Any 3rd-party mod
	that also changes that and that is activated after my mod will remove that fix.

Install
=======
Use Wrye Bash (http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=1840) to install this mod.
Just drag the package (which is a normal ZIP file) into Wrye Bash\'s Installers tab.
Activate the mod.
However, the package is only a normal ZIP file, so if you know the game\'s mod file structure, install it manually.

Uninstall
=========
In the console, type \"setpqv kuvtq uninstallNow True.\"
Wait a few seconds, save the game.
Deactivate the mod with Wrye Bash.
If you installed this manually, simply delete all the files you installed.
(Wrye Bash keeps track of files used, so installing/uninstalling the mod with it is 100% simpler.)
